history.content: I'm in the 137 series now, and I love it! The professor is great, and I find the topics interesting. It covers a really wide range of subjects (many technical aspects, as well as a bit of politics and economics), and there are students from multiple different departments. It definitely makes it easier if you have some basic circuits/electronics knowledge. For me, the class was definitely lighter than EECS lower divs, but there have been some rougher weeks when I have less background in the topics we study. We have weekly problem sets and quizzes.

I was wondering if people who took EE137A/B can comment about how the class is. How useful and interesting are the materials? What is the workload like? How was the organization/teaching of the class?

For some background, I have some interest in the area, but probably will not choose a career in power systems and would want to take the class more for my own interests.
history.subject: Thoughts on EE137?
